greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (1<=k<=n) given by T(n, 1) = T(n,n) = 1, otherwise T(n, k) = (m*n-m*k+1)*T(n-1,k-1)+(m*k-m+1)*T(n-1,k), where m = 8.
comment: The importance of this recursion is that it gives an integer inverse z transform polynomial set:
Table[CoefficientList[ExpandAll[InverseZTransform[b[[k]], x, n] /. UnitStep[ -1 + n] -> 1], n], {k, 1, Length[b]}]
link: G. Strasser, Generalisation of the Euler adic, Math. Proc. Camb. Phil. Soc. 150 (2010) 241-256, Triangle A_8(n,k)
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Nov 14 2009
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 08 2013
